abstract.text: Adds a new credential element to an existing credential.

inlineContent.text: A pointer to the secondary status result that provides additional information in case of failure.
The credential to which the new element should be added. If the
parameter is
, the input credential is modified to include the new element. Otherwise, a new credential that combines the input credential with the new element is returned as the output credential. Specify
to create a new credential with default behavior, in which case the
cannot  be
The name of the entity for which the credential is to be acquired. Specify
to get a credential with a default name or use
to create a name object.
The set of underlying security mechanisms to use with the credential. Use
to get the default set.
A flag that indicates how the credential will be used. Specify
for context initiation,
for context acceptance, or
for both.
The time in seconds that the credential should remain valid for initiating security contexts. Use
to indicate the maximum allowed duration. The value is ignored for credentials with usage set to
The time in seconds that the credential should remain valid for accepting security contexts. Use
to indicate the maximum allowed duration. The value is ignored for credentials with usage set to
A pointer the function uses to return the credential. Set to
to modify the input credential in place. Release the credential’s memory with
when you are done with it.
A pointer the function uses to return the actual mechanisms used by the credential. Set to
to ignore this output. If you do receive a set of mechanisms, use
to release its memory when you are done with it.
A pointer the function uses to return the actual number of seconds for which the credential is valid as an initiator. Set to
to ignore this output.
A pointer the function uses to return the actual number of seconds for which the credential is valid as an acceptor. Set to
to ignore this output.
A status code set to
on success. See
for a description of other status outputs.

abstract.text: Conduct secure, authenticated network transactions.
Creates a credential from a universally unique identifier.
The value that indicates a credential that can accept a security context.
The value that indicates a credential that can both initiate and accept security contexts.
The value that indicates the maximum permitted lifetime when used in a time request.
The value that indicates a credential that can initiate a security context.
The value that indicates an empty credential object.
An empty name object.
The operation completed without error.
A 32-bit unsigned integer.
Evaluate return values that most GSS-API functions use to indicate the outcome of an operation.
A pointer to the OID descriptor that exchanges object identifiers with many GSS-API functions.
A pointer to a descriptor that manages an array of OID descriptors.
Adds a new credential element to an existing credential.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to exchange a credential object with GSS-API functions.
A credential usage value.
Purges a credential from memory.
Converts a name in contiguous octet format to the internal name format.
A pointer to an opaque type that you use to communicate name objects with GSS-API functions.
Releases the memory of a credential.
Releases the memory associated with an OID set.
Changes a credential option.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
